edu.frontrange.csc240.a8

Class TemperatureConversion

  • Object
    • edu.frontrange.csc240.a8.TemperatureConversion

  • public class TemperatureConversion
extends Object
    Main application. This sets up the Model, View and Controller (using the MVC design paradigm) for the temperature conversion application. Further details on this design pattern may be found at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model%E2%80%93View%E2%80%93Controller.

    The converter is actually an enum class which defines the temperature scales (named Scale in this application). This converter is used by the Model to do the needed conversions. The Controller is an instance of a class to which the View delegates all user actions (since the actual Swing architecture is also view/delegate.) The View is displayed in a frame (JFrame) created by the main application entry point, which is in this class.

    Swing elements all include a warning that they are not (with few exceptions) designed for multi-threaded execution, that all operations must happen on a single “dispatch” thread. While it is possible and quite workable for a Swing application to be constructed and run using the main thread as the dispatch thread (so long as the main thread does nothing more after realizing (i.e., packing and/or making visible) the frame, it is always recommended to schedule activities on the View to happen on the dispatch thread, which is done using the SwingUtilities class, and the invokeLater method. This permits the initial main thread to end. The application will stay alive so long as the Swing dispatch thread continues to be alive.

    Version:
    2.0, 2016-10-15, Assignment 8, Exercise 12.13
    Author:
    Dr. Bruce K. Haddon, Instructor
